qas.question: What was Comcast's share value in 1999?
What was Comcast's share value in 2009?
Comcast's revenues in 2009 were how much?
What was Comcast's profit margin in 2009?
What caused a 2012 spike in Comcast profits?
How much revenue (in billions) did Comcast generate due to high-speed internet customers?
What percentage of new customers did Comcast increase by in 2012?
What sports event caused revenues to double from 1999 to 2009?

context: The book value of the company nearly doubled from <a0_0>$8.19<a0_0/> a share in 1999 to <a1_0><b5_0>$15<b5_0/><a1_0/> a share in 2009. Revenues grew sixfold from 1999's $6 billion to almost <a2_0>$36 billion<a2_0/> in 2009. Net profit margin rose from 4.2% in 1999 to <a3_0>8.4%<a3_0/> in 2009, with operating margins improving 31 percent and return on equity doubling to 6.7 percent in the same time span. Between 1999 and 2009, return on capital nearly tripled to 7 percent. Comcast reported first quarter 2012 profit increases of <b8_0>30%<b8_0/> due to <a4_0>increase in high-speed internet customers<a4_0/>. In February 2014, Comcast generated <b7_0>1.1<b7_0/> billion in revenue during the first quarter due to the <b6_0><b9_0>Sochi<b6_0/> Olympics<b9_0/>,.
